com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Utility

  • public class Utility
extends Object
    Various utility methods (currently little-endian value conversion functions for LightX arguments)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Utility() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean getBoolean(byte[] buffer, int offset)
      getBoolean() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from an unsigned 32-bit little-endian integer representation, and returns the value as a boolean.
      static float getFloat(byte[] buffer, int offset)
      getFloat() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from a 32-bit little-endian float representation, and returns the value as a float.
      static int getInt(byte[] buffer, int offset)
      getInt() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from an signed 32-bit little-endian integer representation, and returns the value as an int.
      static long getUnsignedInt(byte[] buffer, int offset)
      getUnsignedInt() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ] and converts them from an unsigned 32-bit little-endian integer representation into a long in host byte order.
      static void putBoolean(boolean value, byte[] buffer, int offset)
      putBoolean() is a utility method that converts a boolean value into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
      static void putFloat(float value, byte[] buffer, int offset)
      putFloat() is a utility method that converts a float value (32-bits on Java platforms) into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
      static void putInt(int value, byte[] buffer, int offset)
      putInt() is a utility method that converts a the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..
      static void putUnsignedInt(long value, byte[] buffer, int offset)
      PutUnsignedInt() is a utility method that converts the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] ..

    • Method Detail

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(byte[] buffer,
                                 int offset)
        getBoolean() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from an unsigned 32-bit little-endian integer representation, and returns the value as a boolean.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the boolean value from
        offset - The buffer offset to start reading from. The buffer must contain at least 4 bytes from offset.
        Returns:
        The boolean value from the buffer

      • getFloat

        public static float getFloat(byte[] buffer,
                             int offset)
        getFloat() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from a 32-bit little-endian float representation, and returns the value as a float.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the float value from
        offset - The buffer offset to start reading from. The buffer must contain at least 4 bytes from offset.
        Returns:
        The boolean value from the buffer

      • getInt

        public static int getInt(byte[] buffer,
                         int offset)
        getInt() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ], converts them from an signed 32-bit little-endian integer representation, and returns the value as an int.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the boolean value from
        offset - The buffer offset to start reading from. The buffer must contain at least 4 bytes from offset.
        Returns:
        The boolean value from the buffer

      • getUnsignedInt

        public static long getUnsignedInt(byte[] buffer,
                                  int offset)
        getUnsignedInt() reads 4 bytes starting at buffer[ offset ] and converts them from an unsigned 32-bit little-endian integer representation into a long in host byte order.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the 32-bit unsigned little-endian integer from
        offset - The buffer offset to start reading from. The buffer must contain at least 4 bytes from offset.
        Returns:
        The unsigned 32-bit integer value from the buffer converted to host byte order

      • putBoolean

        public static void putBoolean(boolean value,
                              byte[] buffer,
                              int offset)
        putBoolean() is a utility method that converts a boolean value into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] .. buffer[ offset + 3 ]
        Parameters:
        value - The boolean value to store
        buffer - The buffer to write the boolean to, in little endian byte order
        offset - The buffer offset to start storing the value at. buffer must be contain at least 4 bytes from offset.

      • putFloat

        public static void putFloat(float value,
                            byte[] buffer,
                            int offset)
        putFloat() is a utility method that converts a float value (32-bits on Java platforms) into a four-byte little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] .. buffer[ offset + 3 ]
        Parameters:
        value - The 32-bit float value to store
        buffer - The buffer to write the integer to, in little endian byte order
        offset - The buffer offset to start storing the value at

      • putInt

        public static void putInt(int value,
                          byte[] buffer,
                          int offset)
        putInt() is a utility method that converts a the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] .. buffer[ offset + 3 ].
        Parameters:
        value - The 32-bit value to store.
        buffer - The buffer to write the integer to. value will be stored in little endian byte order.
        offset - The buffer offset to start storing the value at. buffer must be contain at least 4 bytes from offset.

      • putUnsignedInt

        public static void putUnsignedInt(long value,
                                  byte[] buffer,
                                  int offset)
        PutUnsignedInt() is a utility method that converts the low 32-bits of the long 'value' argument into little-endian representation, then stores the result into the provided buffer over the range buffer[ offset ] .. buffer[ offset + 3 ].
        Parameters:
        value - The 32-bit value to store.
        buffer - The buffer to write the integer to. value will be stored in little endian byte order.
        offset - The buffer offset to start storing the value at. buffer must be contain at least 4 bytes from offset.
